results.title: Prisoners of chance
results.creator_credit: Thom Eberhardt, Marc Stirdivant, FilmFair Communications and Vitascope Productions
results.brief_description: Presents dramatized re-enactments of three case studies of teenage pregnancies: a girl who gives up her baby for adoption when she realizes she cannot cope; a girl who lives with her parents after the birth; and a couple who marries after the girl becomes pregnant. De-romanticises the notion of “Having a baby” by pointing out some commo problems of teenage pregnancies.

results.title: The Price of hunger
results.creator_credit: Kent Smith, Barr Films and Kent Smith Studio
results.brief_description: Documents the problem of worldwide hunger, its causes and solutions. Looks at how Third World governments trade the lives and health of their people for personal gain, how Western foreign policy supports corrupt Third World governments and how multinational corporations use business practices which often rob the poor of their land and food. Also shows how improved farming methods not dependent upon extensive energy and technology or foreign investment could help reduce hunger. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: With Bernadette in Papua New Guinea
results.creator_credit: David Springbett, Heather MacAndrew and Asterisk Film and Videotape Productions
results.brief_description: Focuses n the life of a young girl living in a village in Papua-New Guinea. Shows the customs of the people living the village, the schooling system, the working of garden plots, and the communal effort of the villagers constructing buildings such as an extension for the school.

results.title: With Michael in Kyuso, Kenya
results.creator_credit: David Springbett, Heather MacAndrew and Asterisk Film and Videotape Productions
results.brief_description: Focuses on the life of a young boy living in a village in Kenya. Shows the role of education, the links between the village and the towns and the impact of technology on employment prospects in the village.

results.title: The Voyage of Odysseus
results.creator_credit: Pieter Van Deusen and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: An adaptation of that part of Homer’s Odyssey dealing with the 10 year ordeal of returning home to Ithaca. Stylized visuals are used to recount the story of Odysseus and his companions as they experience the adventures and terrors of the epic journey, notably with the Cyclops, the Laestrygonians, Circe, the inhabitants of Hades, the Sirens, Scylla and Charybdis, Aeolus, Helios and the sacred cattle and Calypso. Narrated by Julie Harris. Models, sculpture and monster animation by John Matthews. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Insects helpful to man
results.brief_description: Shows how humans benefit from the the activities of some insects. Includes a discussion of the benefits derived from bees, silkworms, maggots, dung beetles, lady bugs and ichneumon flies. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Ecological biology
results.creator_credit: Bruce J. Russell and Coronet Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Biological sciences”.
Shows that an ecosystem is a system of interactions between the physical environment and the varied species populations which inhabit it. Describes how the ecological relationships in any given environment follow basic principles. Indicates that our own human species must make informed decisions based on an awareness of these principles and highlights the consequences of ignoring them. Stresses that human activities must be adapted to maintain the delicate balance of a complex worldwide ecosystem.

results.title: Evolutionary biology
results.creator_credit: Bruce J. Russell, Biomedia Associates and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Biological sciences”.
This film presents the salient points of modern evolutionary theory, stressing the role of mutation and sexual reproduction in producing variation within populations. Also examines theories of natural selection and random mutation as explanations of environmental adaptation.

results.title: Developmental biology
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Biological sciences”.
Examines the orderly and inevitable life cycle of an organism from the moment of fertilization through embryology to maturation. This film also probes the role of genetic programming in this biological mystery. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.
